key_points: Tiger Woods has been involved in multiple car accidents throughout his career, affecting both his personal life and career.
In 2009, he crashed his Cadillac Escalade into a neighbor's tree, exposing his cheating scandal and costing his marriage.
Woods was unconscious in the 2009 crash and was rescued by then-wife Elin Nordegren, leading to public scrutiny and a subsequent apology for his infidelities.
The 2009 crash and infidelity revelations caused Woods to lose multiple corporate sponsors and seek treatment at a clinic specializing in sex addiction.
Woods attempted to reclaim his professional and personal life post-2009 incident but faced another setback in 2017 with a DUI arrest in Florida.
During the 2017 incident, Woods was found unconscious in his car with multiple prescription drugs and THC in his system.
Police noted that Woods appeared to have been in a minor accident prior to being found during his 2017 DUI incident.
Woods claimed a reaction to prescription drugs was the cause of his 2017 DUI incident and subsequently sought professional help.
He pleaded guilty to reckless driving in 2017, receiving a year of probation and a $250 fine, and sought treatment for medication management and a sleep disorder.
The accidents and their aftermaths have significantly marred Woods' personal life and public image, despite efforts to recover.
